text: Chapter 11 - Tower of Babel. The whole world had the same language and the same words.

Chapter 11 - Tenth Plague: The Death of the Firstborn. Then the LORD spoke to Moses: One more plague I will bring upon Pharaoh and upon Egypt. After that he will let you depart. In fact, when he finally lets you go, he will drive you away.

Chapter 11 - Jephthah. Jephthah the Gileadite was a warrior. He was the son of a prostitute, fathered by Gilead.

Chapter 11 - Defeat of the Ammonites. About a month later, Nahash the Ammonite went up and besieged Jabesh-gilead. All the people of Jabesh begged Nahash, “Make a treaty with us, and we will serve you.”

Chapter 11 - David’s Sin. At the turn of the year, the time when kings go to war, David sent out Joab along with his officers and all Israel, and they laid waste the Ammonites and besieged Rabbah. David himself remained in Jerusalem.

Chapter 11 - The Remnant of Israel. I ask, then, has God rejected his people? Of course not! For I too am an Israelite, a descendant of Abraham, of the tribe of Benjamin.
